formattedAddress: 104 Vermilyea Ave # B1, New York, NY 10034, USA
adrFormatAddress: 104 Vermilyea Ave # B1, New York, NY 10034-3209, USA

originalText.text: Dr. Steve is very caring and my kids respond to him well. My son needed a blood draw once and the nurse was wonderful with him; it could have been stressful but she made it easy.  Office staff is great - best I have ever experienced for medical care for my kids. They are reachable by email. They got letters and forms to my child's school quickly when needed. They are also good with self-pay; reasonable price for yearly physicals and the related form that goes to NYC schools.  The office staff was helpful and understanding with my concerns about lab costs.

originalText.text:
Wish I could give negative stars.
Dr. Steve Ayanruoh ignored the Pathologist's calls noted on my son's blood work results and put my child's life at risk.

Pros: The receptionist and nurse are nice, friendly, and helpful. Gave me print outs of test results when requested.

Cons: The office is in a dark basement area. The rooms are small, cluttered, and the whole layout is inefficient and disorganized. The waiting room is also pretty small and can build up quickly. The Dr. is nice but doesn't speak Spanish and his English is spoken with a heavy accent and he is difficult to understand. But the main issue I had, was that my son was SEVERELY sick and the Dr., not only waived off the severity of his CRITICALLY LOW iron levels, but he was dismissive of my concerns and only ran more tests because of my pestering and desperate urging. Eventually, I took my son upstate and put him in an ER until an NP was willing to see him and refer him to an amazing pediatrician who was shocked at the sight of my child and his blood work results. She urgently and aggressively pushed to get a hematologist to look at him. After driving many miles to a children's hospital, meeting with several doctors, and having him admitted for almost a month to run multiple tests, he was diagnosed with and treated for Crohn's disease. Thankfully, my son now has a great specialist at Mt. Sinai, but he could have had a heart attack or other organ failure if he had not been diagnosed and treated in time. I feel that Dr. Ayanruoh is on autopilot and is just doing the bare minimum as a pediatrician. Unfortunately, his lack of good, ethical practice and blatant disregard of his Hippocratic oath put my child in grave danger.
If it were up to me, I would have his license revoked.

originalText.text: So unfortunate to read some of this reviews. But personally  I believe  when there are emergencies we got to take our kiddos to the hospital ER,   not to a dr's Office?.. I have never encounter  any issues taking my children  to to Dr. Steve A. And they have grown up healthy. For those time that might of have been emergencies   I drove them to the pediatric ER at the hospital.
